{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Studying here is completely different from high school. You have so many opportunities here, the library is amazing as you can find any book there and there is always someone who can help you if you have trouble with something.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'The accommodation in my opinion is quite cheap and the conditions are good. The university facilities are great and being a part from a society is also a wonderful experience. I have met a lot of new people and both the city and the university are amazing places.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'The best thing about studying here was meeting some incredibly ambitious, intelligent people. Edinburgh Uni certainly provides the right conditions for knowledge to flourish, and satisfies our intellectual curiosity.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'I guess that depends more on your degree rather than solely the name of the university. I am yet to see how things will work out for me. :)'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Interesting couse material.The lecturers are experts in their field.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Modern and comfortable.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "The Counselling team is very helpful. I only wish the waiting time wasn't so long."}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Teviot is the best!'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "I lived in self-catered accommodation (Hermit's Croft) in my first year and loved it! Cozy, clean, located not far away from the central campus."}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "Edinburgh is uniquely beautiful. There's a lot of history and multiple forms of entertainment."}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Huge choice.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'The city is really great and easy to get around. The lecturers are nice and very prepared. Everybody has been very friendly.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'not looking for one'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'The course and the lectures are quite interesting and the conditions in my accommodation are perfect. Furthermore, the university gym is amazing and all the sports facilities as well. We receive lots of support from many people, but the job prospects in the city are not so many.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'the course is very good and there are many teaching opportunities. edinburgh is a great place to live'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'The course is very slow at the moment and the quality of students goes from very smart to abysmal.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'So far it looks promising'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Some lecturers are amazing some are absolutely awful. The course is slow and not engaging enough.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Amazing'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "I've had help when I needed it."}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "Don't really know much about them but they seem okay"}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Very good but a bit on the expensive side.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Again very good but expensive'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'There are societies for everything'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Some of the courses can be challenging in many aspects and therefore there is a lot of help and support available. If I have to outline a single thing that I do not like, are the prices of the accommodation here, which are just too high for most of us.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Studying at the University of Edinburgh is definitely one of the best choices I have ever made. I would recommend this University to every student who would ask my advice.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Really wonderful studying life. With the help of the university of Edinburgh , I can have a good development in the field in which I am interested . I can even attend physics lectures held by successful scientist. The university does really help in realising my dream. Many many thanks to you!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Really like the atmosphere here, really welcoming for a first year student. Plenty of opportunities and wide variety of activities and societies on offer. The quality of lectures are high and really interesting on the most part. There is also great variety on extra lectures one can view if they are interested.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Really happy in general, but dissapointed with delay in getting back grades'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Really good university! Full of opportunities. Best time of my life'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Really a good university to study at and enjoy university life.People here are very friendly and kind. Scenery in Edinburgh is really nice,there are so many visiting old sites to have a look.Edinburgh is no doubt a great choice of having university life.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'One of the most amazing cities I have ever visited for many reasons. There is so much to see, while you are going around the beautiful parks and even in the campus.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Quality teaching, graduating with a good diploma.Plenty of lively clubs and societies.Excellent sport opportunities.Located in historical part of Edinburgh.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Particularly good maths teaching.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Pretty great university, fantastic social life stuff, looks good on a CV to come from Edinburgh uni'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Theyre never open for vets'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Overall, the university is good. I really dislike the fact that is way too academic. Especially the social sciences. There's nothing practical. We are being taught only theories and we don't have any real life experiences. The library is great. Maybe that's my favourite thing about the university. Their book collection is fantastic."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall, it is a Great university, pretty much has everything you need or would want.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall, I really enjoy the University of Edinburgh and the wonderful opportunities available to me at the College of Art. The student life is great as there is always something to do on every night of the week.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall, I have enjoyed my experience at the University of Edinburgh. I am very satisfied with the teaching as well as the facilities so far. Courses are clearly outlined and lectures are interesting as well as well explained. Emails regularly remind students of deadlines and activities, which is particularly important to first-year students who have just began their university experience. Unexpectedly, I believe my current workload is lower than at high school. Perhaps the workload could be slightly higher with more challenging tasks. Nevertheless, I am unable to generalize this to every course.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Overall I would rate my university experience highly, however I don't know much about job prospects or student support so I cannot really say anything about it."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Not too bad'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Regarding most aspects, the teachers are knowledgeable and clear. Furthermore, the tutorials are a great way to crystallize and clarify the class. In my opinion, the accommodation where I live is a way overpriced, but the city is amazing in every single aspect. Regarding the university facilities, The Old College needs some interior renovation. A lot of clubs and societies are provided, but it is not easy to find a free time for many.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Really enjoying my life in Edinburgh Uni. Professors are top-tier and are easily approachable. Clean facilities. The best part is the library- quiet and quite a few books in selection. The workload is challenging but doable. I like the idea of phd students helping out when us students are in need of help (the use of piazza and Mathsbase). Big thumbs up!'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'N/A'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Great library. Nice and cozy temperature.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'N/A'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "Don't care."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Loud at night. Partier upstairs.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Beautiful city and nice people. What more do you want? Almost as good as Tokyo.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Joined the physics society. Great people.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Personally, I am having a fantastic time, studying, whilst meeting new people, whilst bettering myself in every way I see fit. The University as a whole is great. A brilliant study and social space!'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'The career service (MyCareerHub) provides quite a lot of local opportunities. I have, however, not yet tried its effectiveness, to state a full opinion.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Courses are quite well laid out. And the lecturers are friendly, as well as helpful.There is always room for improvement. But I believe the university manages to promote such improvement, in general.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Fantastic learning environment. All facilities (at least the ones I have entered) were well equiped for the necessary tasks.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'I have had some contact with the teaching offices around the university, and they do their job. But there is room for improvement, as sometimes they recieve much more than they can handle in a short period of time (After exams, etc)'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "I have not, yet been in contact with the Students' Union apart from knowing their existance. I have, however not really wanted to do so, either way."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Responce time, regarding issues with accomodation could be slightly better. The conditions as a whole, however, I find fitting and quite nice.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Quite a lot going around in the City of Edinburgh. Lots of things to do and people to meet. University life can be as social as you want it to be!'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': "Finding a fitting student society is easy, and spending time with them is great fun. It's all about finding the right one for yourself."}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall, I am happy with my course and the education that my University provides. I feel like I am developing useful skills and that I am getting to know better how society works through different experiences. The facilities, seminars, clubs and accommodation offer good experiences.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'I think the prestige of The University of Edinburgh opens many doors.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'I like the structure of my course and some of my lecturers but there are some other lecturers that are not very helpful.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'I believe that they are trying their best to provide us with different necessary facilities.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'The buildings are modern but my building is too loud for my liking because people party too much.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "I don't like the fact that most of the time it is cloudy, windy and it is raining outside. Edinburgh is quite expensive for what you get. But it is a beautiful city."}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'There are plenty of Clubs & Societies to join and they organise social events.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall I am satisfied with the University of Edinburgh. The staff and facilities are very good. I would recommend it to a friend.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'overall happy here, students union serious lack of support and lack of information over events'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall experience from the Uni is good. There is room for improvement but you cant have it all.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall a great university, although some departments are really lacking in funds compared to others. Student-institution communication could use some improvement.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "One thing I also have to mention is that it's a really international university. As I have lived in an international environment my whole life this is also something that I would look for in a university. All the events and societies as well as all friends I have made here make me think I could not have done the same in another university and that I have made the only possible right choice in coming to Edinburgh."}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'There are job adverts in every Uni building I can think of and apart from that there are some societies that help with that too. And some of them look pretty amazing...'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': "If I wasn't a sometimes bored first year student not yet learning anything at all this would be a 5. Most lecturers are cool, smart and funny though so it can still be rewarding to go to lectures. Same goes for tutors."}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "One thing that puts me off about this University is how far away King's Buildings, George Square and accommodation are apart from each other. The facilities themselves are great though."}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'So far I managed to get good help whenever I actually needed it...'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'A lot of the events they organize are weekly, but I found some more interesting ones for myself as well and so far found them worth going to.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "Pollock Halls is great, laundry isn't too expensive, the food is usually good (in my opinion, anyway) and living more or less together with thousands of students is also great."}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "I have a strong dislike for nightclubs (which there are enough of even for those who do), but there's still stuff to do for me. Apart from Uni events there's pubs and ceilidhs among many things to try out here. Not to mention how ridiculously nice people here are..."}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': "They're great for entertainment and jobs, and that's really all I want/expect from them."}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall great university.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': "UoE's carreer service has many departments ready to help and the university itself offers part-time jobs to university students."}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': "Most lecturers are fantastic, but there are some that aren't engaging."}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Great facilities.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'My Personal Tutor is great and always willing to help. Also all lecturers have surgery hours if you have any questions and there are facilities that provide help if you need any.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "I don't really know much about the students' union."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'I was staying at Beaverbank Place for my 1st year and it was a great accommodation overall, but it was a bit expensive and about 30 minutes away from campus by foot.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Lots to do.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Many societies and clubs and it is fairly easy to create your own society, if there are enough people interested.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'None'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'My university experience is amazing and I would recommend Edinburgh to anybody.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'My opinion is that overall the university is one of the best. More efforts should be made for improving students satisfaction rate.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'student support may enhance'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 's'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I think the facilities are very good'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Love this university, would highly recommend but its quite competitive. Very diverse student body and an amazing city to live in.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Top notch.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Excellent lecturers and broad range of courses.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Incredible. Several libraries with thousands of collections, labs, help desks, buildings all over the city,'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Excellent help facilities, at least in the Economics and Mathematics courses.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "The most disappointing aspect of the university I find, as the Students' Union doesn't really ask us what we want improved, or implement those improvements."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Felt very safe, range of en-suite and regular sized rooms, great location.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Excellent pubs, clubs and cultural things to choose from.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Very diverse range of societies but there are not very charities you can take part in.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Love the schools'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Love it here'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Leaving home can be a tough experience and the lifestyle change can really hit you. But meeting so many nice people has made the journey not as scary as you might expect and it’s great living in a city like Leeds.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'I have a work placement in 2nd year which will help me with future job prospects. For students who are unsure about what they will do after graduation, there are talks and conferences which reassure students that this feeling if normal and there is information they can seek out about careers.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'The course itself is very interesting as well as the people you meet during your time here. The tutorials are really interactive and you get a real insight in other people’s thoughts as there is a good platform for debate in these sessions. However, the lecture classes are far too big so there is not enough individual focus. The quality of teaching can vary depending on the lecturer, some talk too quickly, some are monotonic. Scheduled lectures are also too spread out across the week; I would prefer to have a day off.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Excellent.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'I am part of a tutor group and can meet with my personal tutor at any time. There is also a support team who work in my accommodation who you can approach with any problems you have about your living, flatmates, and even directions on how to get home if you are stranded late somewhere and need to get home.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'I do not involve myself with the SU.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'I pay £100 a week for self-catered halls, the rooms are good quality and the general area is very pretty. The problem I have with student accommodation is that they do not enquire about your character or personality so you are paired with flatmates who may not have anything in common with and it can be difficult to live and get along with them.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Edinburgh is a really nice city and there are places which are great for nightlife. You can find most things you need on one street so it is easy to get around.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'I have joined the psychology society who are planning a trip to Amsterdam, I have already signed up for this. The Raising & Giving society do so many good things for charity; there is a charitable trip to Uganda and a chance to go mountain climbing to raise awareness.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I've been living in Edinburgh for five months, now. Never been happier!The city is awesome: full of beautiful historical monuments and buildings, rich in clubs, pubs, theatres and cinemas and everything is done for the students! The university facilities are stunning, modern and always perfectly working! The learning system is one of the best in the world, innovative and interactive!"}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "It's good"}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "It's a great university but certainly some areas could be improved."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'It was fairly easy transitioning from high school to university. Lectures were fascinating, studying for the courses did not consume all of my time, and I had the opportunity to try out a lot of new activities through the societies, where I also connected with several new friends. The city is a veritable open air museum, with dozens of fascinating and breathtakingly beautiful places to visit.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'The University of Edinburgh is one of the universities with the highest employment rates after graduation in the UK. It also has a careers service and provides students with the necessary skills for them to find a job through the courses.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'My course starts by covering a broad range of topics, is taught by fascinating lecturers, and offers lots of hands-on experience through practicals and labs. The city is also a major bonus, being very multicultural and vibrant without being overwhelming.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "The university's facilities are excellent, from the libraries to the cafes and from the labs to the lecture theatres."}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "Support is provided to students with physical disabilities or otherwise, as well as to students with financial problems, difficulties studying, and personal and medical issues. This support is provided bot by the university itself and by the students' association. Students receive regular notifications on the services available."}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "The Students' Union is very active. It deals with a broad spectrum of matters, ranging from the prices at the cafes to equality and non-discrimination. It reaches out to the students through activities, regular updates and notifications, and gives students a chance to voice their opinions through an elaborate suggestion site and questionnaires. The UoE is traditionally a student-oriented university and respects the opinions of its students."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'The accommodation is very modern, albeit in an inconvenient location - far from the centre and my campus. Other accommodation sites are more central, however they are more antiquated.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "The best thing about Edinburgh is that there's an endless supply of activities. From walking along the cobble-stoned Royal Mile to climbing up Arthur's Seat, and from going on haunted ghost tours to having a hot chocolate in the Elephant House (where JK Rowling famously wrote some of the Harry Potter books), there's a thing for everyone in this amazing city."}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Scottish Dance Society, Harry Potter Society, Quidditch team.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'It prove to be a great decision to go to The University of Edinburgh. The student life is great, both in terms of academics and also social life. There is really a support from the staff and I do believe I am taking part in an innovative project which is our university. Not to mention the city, as Edinburgh is definitely one of the most beautiful cities in the United Kingdom and in the world. I strongly recommend it to anyone who wants to study abroad or in their own country, Scotland.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'It probably depends on the degree, but there are many assignments, homework and tests you have to do every week. Furthermore, this goes along with reading so I hardly find time for societies and sport clubs as my day is busy anyway.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Incredible city, with a high academic standard and wonderful facilities, would reccommend to anybody'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I was originally attracted to Edinburgh because of the beautiful city and the high ranking of '17th best' in the world. While the city has never disappointed, I've failed to see any proof of the uni's high ranking. Lectures are not engaging and most students do not speak up in tutorial groups. I will be leaving after my first year."}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'rarely engaging'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Not very pretty on the outside, but functional and nice on the inside'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'rarely any hot water'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Chose the uni for the city'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I think the university accommodation is very convenient. There should be more shuttle buses, especially in the morning and evening.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Many of the scholars in the uni are more cut to be researchers than lecturers and tutors. So the organizational aspect of university is not the greatest one. However, everyone is considerate and helping. There are many social and interpersonal activities that both the university and the city provide.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'renowned uni; great future prospects'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'somehow poorly organized'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'could be better organized but everyone is considerate and helping'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'i am not using uni accom but my friends who are are fine with it'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'edinburgh is a beautiful city with a lot of prospects'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'big diversity of clubs and societies with numerous activities'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Lecutures are both thought provoking and fun. Like it very much. Lecturers and tutors are quite nice and responsible. After class disscussion of works and essays available. The evaluaion of course works is objective and subject to high academic standard. Afterall, a very useful studying experience to be added to your CV.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "it's a cool uni"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "it is definitely a great university worth to come. I'm a visiting student studying here for a year and this year must be the year that I would never forget. The classes in gym, the colourful life of societies, the amazing lectures and tutorials and the beautiful sightseeings in Scotland. And UoE really have helped me to improve the abilities to study and review by myself."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I'm generally happy with my university choice and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone, the city's absolutely beautiful and the people here are splendid. The courses are very self directed and could use with a bit more teaching since we're students and we don't actually know what we're doing, but it teaches you to be independent"}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I would like to nominate Professor Kim Picozzi for the university Lecturer of the Year because he is a very charismatic person.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I very much like to study at university of Edinburgh . It makes me feel confident.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Most of the lectures' content is interesting. There is a lot to do in the city (like cinemas). Sometimes there are not enough free spaces in the main library. The students' union is always friendly. And finding a job is fairly easy and the university also helps us regarding this. My overall opinion about the university is very positive."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'More team work than high school. Have more reading test. The grade not only depend on the final exam but also homeworks and tutorials.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'In terms of support services, I wanna say that the disability service could be improved. More individual care is needed.I wanna nominate Professor Anthony Allison for the university Lecturer of the Year because he helped me beyond all other lecturers, with Disability issues.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'In general I am completely satisfied with my university.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'excellent'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I'm very pleased with the the university. It has good facilities and the lectures are well taught. It also has a wide veriety of clubs and societies to choose from. I've already recomended it to friends and helping some of them with the admision."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'If you want to spread your wings and fly then reach for the stars!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'If I have to outline the things that I particularly enjoy in the university - they are many. First of all, the library and the other facilities are great - giving us the opportunity to study and to prepare for the other exams. Secondly, they are numerous societies and clubs, which can help you in a variety of ways. They can support you academically, they organize a lot of social events, sport events, you can meet a lot of new people and make new friends. The city is amazing and I particularly enjoy being student in Edinburgh because there are not so many clubs and other places for night life, so I can focus on my studies which are my priority. This is only my first year in the University but I enjoy the life and being a student here as there a lot of opportunities for me.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I’m so glad that I come to this university! I spend the best time in my life here. There're so many intriguing experiences, so much laughter and tears. I went to audit tons of lectures and most of them are awesome. I made life-long friends here and we shared so many stories that I will never forget. The societies provided us with surprise everyday and the city is already ready for us to explore. To conclude, this is just perfect!"}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'A lot of job information is provided online which help us to gain more experience in future career.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': "Most of the courses in social science are really intriguing. But there're a few boring ones."}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Uni facilities are advanced.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Organizations for supporting and advising is everywhere and they are all willing to help.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Members of Students’ Union are Warm-hearted.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Absolutely love pollock hall (the University Accommodation) where we have had so much fun! But the cost is a bit high.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Edinburgh is an amazing city that worth exploring and learning!!'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Tons of options in societies and the members are friendly.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I would like to nominate Professor Ian Campbell for the university Lecturer of the Year because he is extremely helpful and always has time for you.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I would definitely reccommend University of Edinburgh to deciding students.Edinburgh is a very friendly city and the individual schools want to guarantee students as satisfied as possible.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I would highly recommend the University of Edinburgh, especially for the city and cultural life. As well as your degree, you'll have another kind of education here."}

column3: Electronics and Electrical Engineering with Management
column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I feel to be part of this university. The student community in Edinburgh is fantastic. Of course, you can always encounter a bad tutor/reader, but it can happen at any university. My overall experience so far is just great. I see bright future for myself due to this fantastic university. The only downside are the prices of the flats in Edinburgh.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I like the university and the city as well. The facilities are great, and I am especially impressed by the library and the gym.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I love my university, people, the course, the city, it's amazing. I feel welcome and I'm having a great first year."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I really enjoy my course, edinburgh's a great city to be a student in - so much to see and do; take part in everything you want to. Play sports - it's great for meeting people!"}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I think it has been good. I wish to have, perhaps, better feedback on essays though.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great university. Amazing city and nightlife. The place you want to be both for studying and for having fun!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great university. Since it is in the heart of the city, everything you could want is within walking distance. Not a big fan of my course but the lecturers are nice.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'High quality education'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Highly cultural city with loads to do, great academic stimulation with large variety of extra curricular activities (societies, volunteering, outreach teams, reading groups)'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I am basing my rating on my satisfaction on the education that I am receiving. Overall I am happy with my degree and the syllabus and I believe that if I get good marks I will have plenty opportunities for further studies or job prospects.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'I believe that The University of Edinburgh is very prestigious and anyone with this name on their degree has good opportunities for jobs.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': "I like the course structure but sometimes I don't like the lecturers or their lecture notes."}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'I believe that the university tries hard to find ways to provide us with many different facilities so I am quite happy with this.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Same as above. My support is provided by some of my lecturers/tutors.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "I don't really pay attention to them so I cannot express any opinion."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'The current building I am staying in is very modern and spacious but it is also very loud for my liking because people party too much.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "I don't like the fact that most of the time it is grey outside and it is very windy or it rains. I think Edinburgh is an expensive city especially now that I am looking at flats for next year."}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'There are plenty of Clubs & Societies to join if you have time and they organise socials and events.'}

column3: Master of Arts with Honours Russian Studies and European Union Studies
column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I am generally happy with my university. However, as I have been doing language courses, I would recommend organizing more contact hours that will give students chance to practice more (this to include grammar tutorials, discussion groups and conversation classes). In addition to that, introducing more group projects could be considered very useful because it allows establishing study groups etc.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I am having the time of my life in The University of Edinburgh. Friends, study, work, experience all sums up to the LIFE I want to live. I encounter problems everyday but this student life is getting me through all of it. I would definitely recommend this university to people who want to live a very well balanced life. There are so many opportunities to learn from.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Large business organisation do not hold recruitment programs in all the university in the UK. It does so only in a few selected universities. This says a lot.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Excellent teaching method. Enjoying the course a lot.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Everything about the university is excellent. Cafes everywhere in the campus, printing points, help desks, etc.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'The University and student union has so many helplines and support services. I am from India and the ways here are very different but the support provided by the university helped me settle in Edinburgh very quick.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'They have a free and fair election to start of with. All opinions are considered.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "I wasn't expecting Pollock Halls to be so good. I am sure that the university is going above and beyond to provide such service. Wish I could stay here for my whole degree."}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'One reason I picked Edinburgh as the city of study was that it is the perfect student city. I never take the bus no matter how far the destination is because the weather is amazing and you do not realise how much you have walked until and unless you look at google maps.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': "If the clubs and societies weren't so good I wouldn't have joined 8 societies."}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I am mostly satisfied by my university experience. One thing I would change is the range of courses provided for each degree. At the moment there is little flexibility on that, which limits my preferences.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I am really enjoying my course and love living in such an awesome city :) Would recommend this university to everyone. My uni accommodation for first year is great as well.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I could never imagine studying anywhere else but at the University of Edinburgh. It offers a combination of an amazing city, great education and lovely people.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'The University of Edinburgh is one of the best universities in the world so having a degree from it is highly valued by employers.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'The course is incredibly interesting. The lecturers are all well-known figures in the field of anthropology.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "The university has two campuses - George square and King's Buildings. Both contain a library and Student union buildings."}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'The Advice Place offers supports to students for a range of possible problems - accommodation, health, academic issues, etc. Moreover, each student is assigned a personal tutor, whom they can go to for advice on any enquiries they might have.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'I have only used the ones in the main campus - George Square - Pleasance, Potterrow and Teviot. Different kinds of events are organinsed daily in all three of them.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'I stayed in Pollock halls during my first year. The atmosphere is great. The RAs are friendly and welcoming and really try to make your first year a great experience.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Edinburgh is an amazing city with lots of opportunities and things to do for all kinds of people.No matter if you prefer going to pubs, clubs or enjoying arts and culture - you can find a bit of everything in Edinburgh'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': "With more than 240 societies and clubs to choose from, there isn't any room for complaining."}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I find courses quite fun. Meeting the patients and all the interesting parts of pathology.I would like to nominate Professor Tonks for the university Lecturer of the Year.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I find it in general really good in all aspects: Academic level, Societies and other activities, and social life. Also the premises of the university are excellent and the support(academic and other) is very high.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Course is good. Some Lecturers are exceptionally good, some disappointing.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Nice place in the city, good distance from university/ city center'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I have enjoyed my courses so far. They are challenging but interesting and the facilities all over the campus, including the college of art, are very good.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I have very little issue with the University. Well organised lectures and good societies. The clubs are terrible though, take Hive for an example.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great university, top of the range. Anyone studying here must be privileged to be at such a University.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Great lecturers who explain the material thoroughly.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'All the uni facilities are brand new and top of the range.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Excellent student support from older classes.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'The student union is a dream. Great food and drinks.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Some accomodation is far out but overall its okay.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'City life is amazing, best you could ask for.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'There is a tremendous amount of clubs and societies to join.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I like the university as a whole but the accomodations are way too expensive. The night life could be a bit developed but the opportunities which the university provides are priceless.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I LOVE IT HERE'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': "LOVE LOVE LOVE linguistics, it's my favourite thing ever! Amazing lecturers, fully involved tutorials, and really interesting topics. Maths (my outside course) is great, albeit very hard and HUGE. There's so much to learn! I get annoyed in the lectures however as nobody can keep quiet (not the uni's fault).Spanish is very difficult but enjoyable."}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "For maths, it's great, there is mathsbase and mathspals which almost act as extra tutorials. The support is amazing.For linguistics and Spanish, this is less apparent, but there are regular revision sessions offered by the LangSoc for linguistics."}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "Beautiful old building! Although they shouldn't have replaced the windows with the horrible new ones! #BringBackClassicWindows"}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "I wouldn't know as I'm in UNITE accommodation, but I arranged it through the uni and it's great."}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': "The clubs are better than at home, and it seems there's a society for everything!"}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I love it here.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Not sure! I have been told that it is top ten in the UK and you learn so much here. There are so many networking opportunities to get into if you join the right things!'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Quite variable from good to excellent.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Great cafes and lecture theatres but can be quite expensive.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "Not really sure as I haven't needed to use it but the maths department were very understanding when I did need to hand in work early due to complicated circumstances."}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "I don't spend much time there but it is good and cheap!"}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'I live in a great location, with all freshers which is perfect but of course it is still uni accommodation and its faults are down to us students really. Could do with a lift though!'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Love Edinburgh as a city, absolutely perfect combination (for me) of campus and city. So much to do and still there are opportunities to go to the highlands and see the country on day/weekend trips!'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'You do have to seek some of them out yourself but they are there and well worth joining!'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I love my uni and actually, it is the best place I can be! :)I met a lot of interesting students and academia with whom I share a lot of similar interests wihch is beneficial to my personal development.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'night clubs can be a little bit disappointing'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I made lots of new friends here. Also. I learned a lot about society and the political world which I have found interesting. Most importantly,I have matured as a person for city/ further living.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': '40 for food'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I mean, it's fine. I wish I could say more - perhaps I'm just bitter about Oxbridge rejection, but really, there's something missing. Nobody really had this as there first choice - when you ask, everyone was rejected from somewhere, or couldn't afford where they actually wanted to go. That atmosphere makes it difficult to enjoy at times. There is also isolation at King's - you're so far away from the Central Campus, and few of the buildings have the beautiful facades the university seems to prostitute on every prospectus cover. Many science students feel cheated, and as a matter of fact, some humanities students do too - some buildings in George Square clash horribly with the other, historical buildings."}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': "I think I'll manage, but I don't know whether that's my work ethic or the university's name =."}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'The broad range of subjects covered within modules, flexibility of degree, outstanding lecturers.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "They are very good; I'm situated in King's, and the library facilities are immense."}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'We have ""personal tutors"" but that\'s just Edinburgh trying to replicate Oxbridge and failing. One half-hour meeting (if you\'re incredibly lucky) at the beginning of a term hardly constitutes a tutorial system. The biology lecturers were very supportive with our first essay, which was great.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "I'm not sure what they do, really."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "I'm in catered, Holland House, and it is probably the only house that hasn't been done up. The pantries are grim, not really any area for socialising etc.."}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Wander.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Loads, but I primarily attend ZooSoc, which is very active.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I personally think studying in the university of Edinburgh is the best choice for me. I can improve my professional skills and enhance the capability of finding a promising career, also I live in the world's most famous tourist spot. The living conditions, combined with the academic atmosphere, will make the research process less exhausting and vivid."}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Though the course are sometimes intense and challenging, I can learn a lot from the lectures and coursework.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Well-equipped facilities, gyms, libraries, cafes. etc.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Somewhere can be very satisfying and cosy, somewhere is a little far form the campus.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Brilliant city environment and public constructions.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Various clubs and all kinds of societies that students can spend their leisure time on.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I really enjoy the University.The lecturers are really professional and they prepare us for the exams really well. They are also tutorials, workshops and other sessions that additionally prepare you. I found really useful the sessions by other students as they have done the same exam a year ago and gave us a lot of useful ideas how to prepare well. The library in the university is amazing as it is the perfect place to study, provide us with lots of resources and works almost 24 hours a day.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I really like the university and I have made a lot of friends here. I would recommend the university to my friends back home.The facilities and student support are really good. And yeah.. fantastic!!I love the university!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I really like the University, both the courses and the social life as well.The university encourages the students to think about the current on going problems as well as of the future.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I really love going to the University of Edinburgh, there is always stuff to do and lovely people to meet. My lecturers make the classes so much fun that I find myself looking forward to the next lecture'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Amazing teachers, the best ones I have ever had with out a doubt'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Never has any relation with them :)'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "Very good, but I don't really enjoy the food"}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Very international city, with lots of stuff to do'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'EUCC Edinburgh university canoeing club is amazing, the people are great and the kayaking is so much fun!!!'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I think that my University is one of the best in the world.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': "There are a lot of prospectives for jobs, but I haven't had the chance to apply."}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'The organisation of the courses is really good.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'As a player in the University team I really like the gym and all other facilities.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Good, good accomdation especially Chancellors!'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great University with supportive stuff and good facilities.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Good uni course'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Good Lectures! Good Library! Convenient transport! In a word, GOOD!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'good facilities good accommodation. Would recommend to anyone interested in social sciences or business. Also very good student life at the halls of residence.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "General speaking, I feel good about our university. Though sometimes I feel a bit lost. Like a fish in a huge pool, there're so many people in the university and too many things going on. Some times people make mistakes when they choose clubs and societies, in which circumstance they will not feel connected to others."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'First of all, the university improved my ability to learn by myself and still have help whenever I need it. column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh University had become my new home, and has been such a welcoming experience, especially as I have come from an international background.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh University is a fun university in terms of societies, but tends to not be as friendly as expected. Unless you attend halls or join societies in first year it is very hard to make friends in other subjects. I would recommend Edinburgh University (especially the Earth Sciences department which is amazing), but any student has to be extremely proactive as they do not receive any help with work.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'I cannot comment on this as I was never in university halls as a home student.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'There is a huge selection of amazing clubs and societies! Everything from kayaking to knitting to swing dance!'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Edinburgh uni so far has been great. The quality of teaching and materials have been awesome and I have really enjoyed my course and the university life and city. The societies have allowed me to make lots of friends as well and the city isn't too expensive if you budget."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great university, interesting course and people. Amazing city and nightlife'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Great city. Fantastic facilities such as the library, computer access and gym. Brilliant societies available and a really nice student union in Teviot Row House. Only downside is the expense and in regards to courses the university uses it's research and international reputation to compensate for the lack of quality teaching and teaching time offered to undergraduates"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great range of courses on offer. Great Facilities. The degree programme is very flexible. Lecturers are generally great. And the university is in my favourite city in the UK.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great uni, quite independent which can be intimidating at first, but useful in the long run'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Despite some minor issues, overall I am happy with my education and life in Edinburgh Uni.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': "Every semester there's at least one subject that's a total waste of time but overall I am satisfied with the quality of the course"}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "The one time I had to get some financial support, the Uni wasn't very helpful."}
