column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "The clubs are nothing like the ones back home and it's a bit expensive."}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': "I don't have much experience with these."}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Definitely a university that accepts only the best students from all over the world. High level of equality between international students and locals. Lots of opportunities to get help from the university concerning not only academic issues but financial and lifestyle as well. My overall rating of ""4"" is due to the School of Engineering needing some further advancement in key areas such as tutorial teaching and practicals. However, it is worth to mention that throughout my 3 year studies in the university so far, the quality of teaching has increased substantially.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'People from industry seem to appreciate the UoE as an institution.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Some are really good, others (most thought by lecturers teaching the course for the first year) are quite poor in communication with the students.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Extremely good. All kinds of electronic appliances meant to help students throughout their academic life. Library most often than not extremely useful.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "Haven't really had the need to use their services, so can't tell."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Expensive, but the newly built accommodation blocks are of really good quality and comfort.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Extremely good air quality! Not too expensive, but ready-made food and nightlife (which is not really of interest in this case) is on the expensive side. City buildings are all really old, so you cannot expect much luxury from the student flats rented in the central area.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Lots of clubs and great variety of them!'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Decent uni'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Course is really good and interesting. Student union buildings are awesome. Pollock Halls is a great environment and really social.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Coming to edinburgh was the best decision i could make, it gave the oportunity to meet so many different people and get to know myself :)'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "best way to judge a uni is go the the history of art lectures and see the standard of girls you're dealing with."}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'im going to be a baller #bdb'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Before coming here i didnt knew much about how the university was and how my course will be like but after coming here i dont regret about choosing University of Edinburgh as my university.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Beautiful city, very organised university, a wide variety of courses to choose from with a very active student life. City and university has lots to offer and cares about a student's social life as well as academic achievements. Overall, I am very happy to be here."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Any university you choose you'll like if you try! But still I would like to recommend this university. It is a great one and definitely worth trying."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'All round excellence'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'A wonderful university that offers amazing tutors, professors and facilities. Especially so for Computer Science - the courses are interesting and beneficial on a personal and professional basis. The students are on a high level as well.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Engaging and interesting lecturers, that cater to every level of initial knowledge of the subject.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'A variety of courses are offered. We have so much options , which enable us to choose the courses that we are most into. Also, the campus is in the city center and that is quite convenient.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'A great uni overall! The fact that most of studying has to be done in your personal time is a bit upsetting, apart from that, fantastic!'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'A good, but not excellent university.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh is a really lovely city and the atmosphere at the uni is great. There are so many great societies and people are really friendly.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh as a city is great and the university of Edinburgh is one of the best in the world and I am overwhelmed with joy to study here!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh is such an engaging, vibrant city to study in and the University of Edinburgh definitely reflects this. The school has so much to offer so many different kinds of people.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh is fantastic! Staff members, peers, atmosphere, demands -- all wonderful.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh is a great city to live in, with great places to see. The course is challenging, but the people make it a good working environment.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Edinburgh is a fantastic university for almost all courses. It's extremely accommodating to anybody who wants to find the balance between an active social life and a high quality of teaching. It has an edge over most universities in London because there's less of an oppressive big city feel, it's safer, slightly cheaper and more relaxing. The downside is that anyone living in self catered accommodation is missing out on the social atmosphere of Pollock halls where most first year students live."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh is a dream and I love it- I would recommend the uni to everyone.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Some are amazing and some are awful.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Gym, JCMB and student unions and library are amazing.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Accomodation was brilliant until we got mice from the flats around us.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Theres so many societies to choose from- theres one for everyone and everyone is so friendly- its a great way to explore a new interest, make new friends and get more involved in uni life.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinbrugh is decent as it gets. Having to live in this city has its perks'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Sufficient'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Not always vocal'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Edinburgh is nice'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Diverse'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Economics lectures are really interesting. Staff here can always explain things clearly.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Could be more done in terms of genuinely feeling like student feedback is being used. Student halls could be a little bit more updated although the security in Robertsons Close is fantastic - as is the common room which I feel is underused. All in all I am incredibly glad I chose to come to Edinburgh.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Definitely a world class university, but the whole experience feels structured around grades, rather than teaching.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Having good grades is essential. Nonetheless, I do feel that the university experience here has provided me with some useful skills and knowledge too.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Most of the lecturers are truly world class, and the courses engage us in interesting topics. The assessment criteria are awful, however, hence I\'m giving it a ""4"".'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "The facilities are very well equipped. There's rarely something missing."}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "Student support is helpful, but there's not that much they can do."}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "The students' union is decent, but they are rather bureaucratic and excessively politically correct."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Accommodation varies in quality. There tend to be lots of generic layouts, which can become annoying.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Edinburgh is a very pleasant city apart from the gloomy weather.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Edinburgh university is home to some excellent societies. Definitely one of the highlights of uni life.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'In my final year, I am currently loving my university experience. The course modules are much better now than in the 1st and 2nd year. My only advice is that be prepared to step up from school, be actively involved in societies. There is really something for everyone.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'There is a great atmosphere around the main George campus always. Everyone is very friendly and the nightlife is great. I would recommend not going through the uni for flats but instead going to private landlords, not only are the prices better but they are better location too'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh University has a fantastic staff in regards to lectures and tutorials. It has an excellent selection of internet resources that allow easy access for studying at home. There is a vast array of societies meaning you can even play if you are so inclined.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'My university experience has been defined by involvement in societies. Edinburgh as a city is absolutely amazing, it feels safe and it is both cultural and fun. As an international student you end up paying a lot for money for every few contact hours for guidance. Having said that my dissertation supervisor was incredibly helpful and I enjoyed that aspect'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "University of Edinburgh is the best. Good facilities and student support. Lecturers are world class and interesting. Bars are good and there's an awesome mix of Oxbridge rejects and rich Americans which allows me to have free education. I would definitely recommend this uni, it has something for everyone."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I have really enjoyed my time at the Uni so far. I lived in self-catered halls in first year and met some of my closest friends there. I would really recommend it. My course has been enjoyable so far although the communication and feedback from the department could be improved'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Really enjoying my time here, I came up from South Wales and meeting new people and getting to know the city was really easy. Staff are helpful and recently I have been building my portfolio for an interview to which tutors are very helpful and guiding me to find a placement in the fourth year'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I am loving my time at the University of Edinburgh. The classes are really good and I am really enjoying the student life, met some great people here. As an international student I felt very welcome. My most important piece of advice is that to know to organise your time and work'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Student life is great, loads of free time so take the advantage of student union and clubs and societies. Courses could be better in many ways. Beware! The uni offers very little career advice though good for interview practice if you book in advance. Just make sure to take of yourself when it comes to careers and internships'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'great uni'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I've had an excellent undergraduate experience at Edinburgh and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Fantastic university with excellent teaching and a vibrant student atmosphere. The School of Law is in the beautiful building of Old College and really does instill a sense of following in the footsteps of fantastic minds who have studied there before you. Edinburgh as a city is wonderful, and campus is set right in the middle of it, with easy access to the main attractions, nightlife and sports facilities.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "UoE is a top rate university and I am so grateful that I'm here. Excellent and knowledgeful lecturers (of course some better than others), great support from academic staff and great facilities. The city and the friendly atmosphere definitely is part of my love for this uni."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Can be very unorganised but great overall'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Excellent lecturers - Jose are involved in making the law or at least advise government'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Bit pricey but Potterow is great'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "I was not in halls so don't know that well"}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "the most beautiful university in scotland, and it deserves it's amazing reputation."}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'seems to be incredibly employable'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'great and informative, just slightly disorganised at times.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'ample study space and student union is amazing.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'never really needed to use it so i do not know.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'brilliant building, association and opportunities.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Catered is great.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'amazingly cultured and vibrant city.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'too many to choose from.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Excellent Uni !'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall good city to live in, the uni is good in terms of facilities and job prospects, but very, very average in terms of teaching and student support'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'over all really good experience so far'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'great uni'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Excellent university'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I find the experience at Edinburgh university to be amazing and I really enjoy both the academic and social side of things. My course is very well taught and there are a lot of social activities as well.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "It's a wonderful place to learn and Edinburgh is a gorgeous city. The university name is extremely useful for tracking down jobs after graduation as it is recognised as being a leader in the field."}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Generally very good.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'perfect :) lovely city to study in.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Overall, I am incredibly happy with having chosen Edinburgh. The university cares about its students more than any other university I am aware of, and the quality of teaching in my specific school is great. The city of Edinburgh is both beautiful and provides a perfect balance between the student community and local amenities.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I feel that there is a huge jump from 2nd year to 3rd year, and it is not a positive change. However, this greatly varies from school to school- the Business School (where I was a student before), for example, is very organized and has a lot of funds. I wish I could say this of my own department.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'You need to watch out for yourself and do a lot of extracurricular stuff to be at the top of the list- but I imagine that this is the norm nowdays due to the demands of potential employers.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'unfortunately this varies greatly over departments and study years'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "there are old and gloomy buildings from around the 70s (I'd say), but everything is being renovated. The new school of languages is fantastic, as is the extension of the David Hume Tower with underground facilities from last year. They have just refurbished an entire gym too with new, modern facilities. I can see that they are not sitting idle on a pile of money handed in by the students."}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Teviot is amazing as always, but I struggle to see what else the union does.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Edinburgh is a beautiful touristic city, full of places to go, but this also means that prices can be high'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'more than 200 societies to choose from. One needs to keep trying and will succeed in finding a place, as it happened to me.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'The University is really great, It offers so much to home and visiting students. I have to say there is alot of support given to students, particularly from the disability team. The university accomodation is quite expensive in relation to the standard of rooms etc, however I no longer stay in residence and i think it has been recently inproved. The university would benefit from increased security around campus and cheaper food in the library cafe. But overall I love the University as it offers great education and great support to students.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh is a great city to study in and the university has an excellent reputation. However, there is a feeling that the university tend to rely heavily on their reputation and perhaps do not make as much effort with teaching standards and student support as other less prestigious universities.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Not many opportunities for beginners taking up a sport. More often you have to already be playing a sport at a competitive level in order to continue with it at Edinburgh University.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'A great university run by an incompetent few. The general standard of teaching is lower than at many places around the UK but the city is so good to live in that there is a constant trade off between a worthwhile educational experience and a genuinely engaging and vibrant student life.'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Frequent strikes and often poorly organised. The online system is rudimentary compared to other universities whilst the lecturers are often not very good at using its most basic functions.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Overall quite good although can sometimes be confusing. There are so many departments for things that personal tutors have no idea where you should go to enquire about certain issues.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'EUSA are notorious for being the most opinionated and pointless student union in the country. Often campaign against relatively trifling matters rather than suggesting any useful change. Their crusade against the male members of the university is infantile and misguided.'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "one of the best places in the country to live as a student. Cheap accommodation and average living costs combined with a huge variety in things to do. I've spent three years here now and am still discovering amazing things I have never tried."}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Excellent establishment if you work hard and take advantage of everything on offer. Between the many societies, academic and social, as well as the wide range of courses, Edinburgh caters quite broadly. However it is a moderately expensive city to live in which could be a problem.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Same as any other university'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Lectures generally quite good but a lot of overlap between courses.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Archaeology labs are very well equipped and there is always sufficient rooms for study/work.'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Quite limited'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Well equipped student union, occasionally difficult to book for functions and could be cheaper.'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Very average student halls'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Excellent city.'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'So many societies and groups to choose from, world class brass band too.'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Poor student support but overall great uni.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Very happy with everything at Edinburgh. The city, nightlife, library, union and facilities are second to none!'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'enjoyed my time here and feel that the student support offered has been excellent - particularly with the careers advice given'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'No experience of uni accommodation'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "The Edinburgh University Student Association is a disgrace - it doesn't represent the views of students and exists solely to fill the CV's of the people in it."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Job prospects, accommodation and quality of teaching all big pros.'}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Good Overall'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Amazing lecturers which have made for an enjoyable four years studying what I love!
The city in which the university is based makes attending Edinburgh University even easier!
The family environment in the schools which I have been a part of have been great!
Wide variety of clubs and societies, which I would have got involved in more if the course wasn't so heavy!"}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Constant emails about future career prospects outside as well as inside the university'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'best part of the university!\nAltogether amazing!'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Quite expensive is its only downfall!'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Pollock Halls was a lovely environment in which to spend first year of university'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Best place to live!'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Some lecturers seem as if lecturing shouldn't be part of their job, just not enough effort or thought.\nHowever the vast majority of lecturers are enthusiastic, willing to help and nice people.\nAlso, there is a bit of an English, privately educated clique in Edinburgh university. Sounds a bit xenophobic, but it does have an impact on the way you feel in the university. Feel a bit belittled by such an overwhelming presence of wealthy, privately educated people. "}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Feel as if the increase in the number of universities and courses is devaluing an undergraduate degree. Whilst going to Edinburgh might increase my prospects comparatively to other universities, I feel as if the next 5 years is relatively bleak job-wise'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Libraries, gyms are great'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Lots of support when you need it for all different things'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Good cheap drinks and food. Loads of services'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Amazing city to live in'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "The university although good, does not offer much in the way of student support. It is hard to switch courses even if you have taken a subject as an outside, and people often are rejected from courses, what kind of university doesn't want their students to do as well as possible?"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Fantastic reputation, beautiful city...but very average teaching. Very little professor-student contact, minimal help from the university for post-grad plans. '}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': "Uni isn't too great at helping us get into the workforce. I've done all my work experiences with my own initiative"}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Very average.'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Great, up to date tech in libraries, everything is online and smooth'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'Could be better...'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Unfortunately highly politicized, they are generally not too respected by the student body. '}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Great halls'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Amazing city to be a student in'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Great variety'}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great city to be in, have loved all my 4 years spent here. Not enough students from the home nations. University has a good reputation which helps trying to find jobs. Most time spent at vet school which has up to date technology and excellent staff. '}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Prepares you well for jobs'}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': 'Could be better timetabling'}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": 'Very modern'}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'On offer but need confidence to search it out'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Weekly updates good'}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Never had a problem'}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': 'Quite a small city but always fun'}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Society for everything '}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great university with great teaching. Amazing student experience and amazing city. I have met so many amazing people and have loved spending four years in Edinburgh.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Certainly world class in both its research and its teaching, something that is reflected in your everyday student life. A truly inspiring university located in the historic city centre of Edinburgh. '}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'The University does not live up to is prestige name! The large number of students you would think would make it easy to make friends but it is the complete polar opposite, if you made it there off of your own back by obtaining good grades rather than Mummy and Daddy paying for you to be there you are the outsider and made aware of this constantly. It is full of public school students and foreign students meaning Scottish students feel like they are on an exchange. The standard of teaching is extremel poor and it is as if lecturers get in and out of the lecture as quickly as possible even if this means missing out part of the course that they have not been able to cover in the designated time period. Feedback is nonexistant and very little help or guidance is provided. In the four years i spent at this university i felt that instead of improving i was taking steps backwards. Not only this but the whole environment and feel of the university is distant from the City in which it inhabits so if you are drawn to the neauty of Edinburgh, the uinversity could not be more distant from this. In my four years it never made me realise who i was as a person, rather it destroyed me as a person, causing me depression which was then even more poorly helped by the university as the councilling sesions on offer were in the middle of the library meaning there was no confidentiality and a maximum of 6 sessions was allowed with no more after.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Unemployable and didn't enjoy my learning or student experience. I wouldn't recommend coz there are too many yahs and you don't get a very good education. I wouldn't bother with this place since everyone is so stuck up. "}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': 'Too expensive'}

column3: International Relations and International Law MA (Hons)
column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I`m not a student in it, because I`m not still at this age, but I give my vote for University of Edinburgh, because I dream of its perfection...and what better reason?'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Ok, but hugely overrated. I often felt as if the only reason I was there was to make money for the university. Some lecturers should never have been put in front of a class in the first place.'}
column5: {'How does your uni make efforts to increase your employability (careers department, work placements, transferable skills)?': 'Degrees from Edinburgh still carry some clout. Goodness knows how. '}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "Throughout my time, I spent very little time on campus outside lectures and tutorials. The trip to the library was like entering death row, with hundreds of glum students jammed in between shelves of countless books. \nDespite this, most of them appeared to be watching Funny Cat Compilation Videos their equally miserable friends had sent them on BookFace. I recall when on a number of occasions, I would be in a desperate rush to print an essay or assignment, only to be prevented from doing so by a YouTube-addicted first year, taking a well-deserved break from his course on Semantic Externalism, by watching 'My Chihuahua Being a Chihuahua' or some similarly pointless drivel on the university computers. "}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': "Couldn't support a single American, never mind 10000 of them. But who can, really? "}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": 'Good nachos. '}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "Edinburgh's a good city to live in. Better than Glasgow. "}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Mostly run by ex-public schoolboys, dressed in tweed. No patience for those guys. '}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Edinburgh is a beautiful city and with a combined good student union, it makes way as a really fun place to study. There is so much to do here that you'll feel you won't have enough time to get through it all.\nHowever, I didn't enjoy my course because it lacked what I came for which was Maths. In the first two years, you take many outside courses which is a benefit to most however I wanted to concentrate and learn about my subject."}
column6: {'What do you like most and least about the way your course(s) are taught?': "I made the mistake of coming to Edinburgh (coming from England) not knowing that their four year courses included many outside courses. This meant that I was not learning my course, Maths like I wanted to. The lectures themselves: in first year, lectures include clickers which allows students to communicate to one another when a question appears. The downside is that it takes up a lot of time hence, the depth of content isn't covered like it should be and I felt I wasn't learning as much as could do. \nThe course at Edinburgh is the one reason why I wouldn't continue at this university hence the bad rating. Another reason is that many of the students didn't choose maths as their main course thus it was hard to meet people on my course with a general interest for it. \nIf you can pick a subject that you do like here then you'll find you'll enjoy the rest of the university easily."}
column7: {"How good are your university's facilities?": "Library is fantastic. Although it does get packed easily. However, the facilities are great and there's a good student vibe. George Square is where you feel the student vibe. Students everywhere walking about gives it the campus feeling that you wouldn't think it had because it is in the centre of the city.\nA massive gym complex (CSE) nearby which is £106 a year. For great prices, the gym offers so much in terms of equipment. With a separate room for everything you really do feel you're getting your monies worth. \nThere is a Blackwell's bookshop 5 minutes away from George Square which is handy for textbooks at lower prices."}
column8: {'How good is the support offered by the uni? Think both academic (tutors/feedback) and personal (counselling, etc).': 'For maths, there is an online website where students asks for advice which is really good because all students can look at these. There is also a group called Maths Pals which allows students to go and ask for advice about anything. A lot of help is given on this that it is unfortunate the system for mathematics lectures were not the same.'}
column10: {"What do you think of your Students' Union in terms of student representation and facilities?": "There are two main spots for the union, Potterow and Teviot. The latter is a Hogwarts like building that is upbeat inside. You really feel the student vibe when you're here. Potterow is where the night events happen however for such a big university, the facilities are quite small on a busy night.\nFor a night out, there are plenty of clubs (relatively small) yet enjoyable as well as pubs ."}
column11: {'What do you think about the safety, condition, location and cost of your accommodation?': "The main residential hub is Pollock Halls. 2000 students live in this catered area and it is a great place to meet people. It's even worth the extra walk. \nI stayed in private accommodation (Chalmers Street) and apart for the price, all facilities were amazing. Double bed and massive kitchen is a big bonus for self catered. The only issue was that many of the people here were not from Edinburgh University hence it was difficult to mix in with my university. My advice is that if you would like an easy in for the social life, then go to Pollock Halls"}
column12: {'Is your university in a good location in terms of distance to accommodation and local amenities?': "It's breathtaking when you get here and walk through the streets with all the cultural buildings. There's a castle in the middle of the city! The Prince's street area is great for shopping and the Scottish atmosphere all year round is great. There is much to do and walking up Arthur's seat (extinct volcano) gives you an thrilling view of Edinburgh.\nUsually you'll have too much to do thus, it's hard to get all the fun city stuff in. "}
column13: {'How would you rate the variety of societies/sports?': 'Clubs are great. In the cricket club there are many social events as well as training. Edinburgh are known for winning many club sport. The table tennis club and tennis club are run quite well and there are many new sports like Ultimate frisbee and Shinty that you can try out. \nThe societies tend to die down after Freshers however in the ever cool sounding Maths society, events such as pub quizzes and pub golf are only a handful of events that go on. Societies tend to do families nights so that all years are brought together. '}

column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Pollock Halls, the student accomodation is grreat! So many people, clubs, sport. Never get boring here. Mechanical Engineering is fascinating, workshops are helpful and interesting. Lectures are Nt so much. Make sure you prepare for exams!!!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "The best time of my life. University has completely changed my life after I separated from my parents and it's awsome! A lot of things to do and responsibility tho. I think the best part of uni is becoming independent so if you want this you are gonna have a great time."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Cool Uni. I am enjoying the IT labs, they are quite reliable and reasonably modern. I think my course is pretty cool and so far I am enjoying halls! Found a lot of cool guys to share my interests, don't have to go solo queue anymore ;)"}

column3: International Relations and International Law MA (Hons)
column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Best University in the world! I chose Edinburgh over a lot of big name universities back in the US and I am glad I did! I am also very glad that I decided to come to Scotland, challenging academics, Amazing nightlife!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "All in all everything is good and I have a lot of free time.I enjoy the night life of Edinburgh and don't miss any chances to go out with my friends.Don't forget to study though!"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Study hard, get good grades, get into uni. Good courses and lectures. Student Union is far away, but averagely good. Study what you like and university will be fantastic. People here, are from everywhere, good to socialize and live with them. '}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I am very keen on history so Edinburgh is te pecfect place for me with it's wonderfull architecture and historical places.I love going out with my friends and the campus is Nt far away from the centre.People should come and visit his place!"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Interesting double major. Good, fair teachers. Lectures are fairly interesting. Overall 3, as accomodation and student union is poor. Many international people around the university. Opportunities to go study abroad are great. '}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Up to moment I honestly don't feel like doing something here.The only thing that is kind of entertaining is spending time in the student's union."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I worked pretty hard to get into my course and to be honest I was expecting a lot more. {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I like it so far, however, I'm thinking about changing the accommodation as I don't like it.The city is beautiful, but people aren't that attractive."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Nt a bad experience at all. Uni life is amazing and I love my society here, deffinetly a good place to meet people. {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "So glad I chose to come all the way from America to Edinburgh Uni! I'm having sucha a great time so far and hope there are even better times to come. Deffinetly recommend this uni to everyone in the world!"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'By a bus pass, you will need it around Edimburgh! Edinburgh is lovely specially when the sun is up! It is the best place to study in Uni. Great choice, Nbody regrets it. Course is very interesting, great job prospects. '}

column3: Portuguese and History of Art MA (Hons)

'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Night life is great but I was really expecting more from my course. I am very bored, especially in the second semester. If you want to study ecoNmics, Uni if Edinburgh is Nt the place. Seriously, its terrible.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "University is fun. I am having a lot of fun both in class and outside. Great experience. Uni is a great place to socialice with peopl with the same interests so don't hesitate and come."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I think Edinburgh University is a great university to study in. The courses and learning opportunities are top-Ntch! Moreover I am really considering my placement as a serious job after I finish. It would be great since I already kNw the staff very well. Apart from that i reccomend this or any uni to everyone because there is Nthing quite like "the university experience"'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I'm so grateful that I came to tudy here.It everything I expexted and even more.I advice everyone to apply for University of Edinburgh and study here.The city is beautiful and Calton Hill is my favourite place from Nw on."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I like everything about the uni and it's facilities.I don't go to any societies but some of my friends do and they say it's worthh it.I'm thinking about visiting some.Why don't you do the same from the next year?"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Halls are cool and all, also like the town. I enjoy the cultural diversity. Uni is Nt impressive, I don't feel very engaged with the material. Would recommend that you pick the best suited for you course in the best place."}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Demanding, but awarding double major.'}

column3: Literary Translation as Creative Practice MSc
column4: {'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'My course is interesting, involving. It is nice to be around plenty of students in the Student Hall. Every nationality is present here, many interesting people. You can learn something new every day here. Join Societies, makes your time fly away quicker. '}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Univeristy of Edinburgh offers a good double major opportunity. I chose literature and art history as it fits together in many aspect. I like art history more, as it is really fascinating to learn about a course with directly reflects in the city. Edinburgh is old and modern at the same time, full of history, and art. City life is great, and Love Edinburgh how busy it is every day. '}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Pollock Halls has every nationalities. It is good to walk around many people. Really good University in the middle of Edinburgh. Many sport societies, good to socialize. '}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Great job perpect, great curse. Applied Sport science, is very interesting, however lectures sometimes are bad. Great place to study, edinburgh has it all. '}
{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "All in all it's Nt bad and I like ot.I have cool mates with interests close to mine.Write a good personal statement!"}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Uni is alright, I like that I was able to find a really good payed job with their help. I am also pretty happy with my course besides the part that I am really busy. If you are coming here and you need to support youself throughout your studies you should kNw that it is hard. I think that putting in hard work is really rewarding tho. Good luck!'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'This is a great university. I am absolutely loving both my course and the student experience. Of course I have a lot to study and a lot to do but it is really interesting and engaging. My placement is really great as well, I think I am getting on really well with the staff of the hospital and I might even consider it as a real job perspective when I graduate.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Such a great town, Edinburgh. It is most deffinetly the place to be, so are the halls and our society parties are just the bomb. Reccomended club to join - Scotish sport group of guys ;)'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'This is my last year here and I can say that this place is good for MA students.The campus has a good location and that is the reason why I still prefer to live here.My dvice is that you need a good personal statement to come in the uni.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "I think uni is pretty cool. Can't complain that I am bored or anything there is always something to do. People are really chill around. Uni's cool if you have money ."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Uni is awsome! Before this I was never actually enjoying my class work in school but here the learning opportunities are so much better and I love it. I don't think there is anything better than doing what you love, so if you love chemistry Edinburgh Uni is deffinetly the place to be."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Fascinating course, with many combibned workshops. Great job prospects after uni, University of Edinburgh also provides many study abroad programs. Forrigners all around, as it is well kNwn. City life is great, so many are going on all the time. '}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "Nice uni! Haven't looked at the town a lot yet, tho. Appart from clubs which are great.. I think I need to allow myself some daytime out in the town because since I got here I have been sleeping through most of the days. Oh well. I am kinda disappointed with the union tho, It's really far away and I dont like the events."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'Edinburgh is great, I love the nightlife, its an easy pull. The girls are great, so are the rest of the people. My course is ok, kind of boring but I have some brilliant lecturers. Other than the nightlife, there are plenty of other things to do in this beautiful city. the sports through the university were great.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I am so happy with my choice to come here, it is so comfortable, this lifestyle at the moment. The course is stimulating and challenging, but not so hard to make it a chore. I am a member of the netball team and love it. I regularly go out and I thoroughly enjoy it. Even if drinking isnt your thing there is plenty to get up to in the capital.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': 'I have been at both St Andrews and Edinburgh university, both institutions are excellent and I have really enjoyed my time here. I definitely would recommend both of them and I am very glad that I studied with them.'}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "To me, Edinburgh Uni is a classic university that is big, traditional and very diverse. You could find any kind of people and research there, simply because of its size.
The size means that many administrative processes are very slow and inefficient, but not as bad as to seriously affect your study experience. For example, they switched only recently to a new e-mail provider to replace the previous outdated e-mail provider (a change that had been done at my previous university, a small campus university, many years before). Generally, IT services are not very good. For example, staff and PhD student pages are seriously outdated and the university even recommends PhD students to create homepages on external blogging sites because the university is unable to provide its own platform.
The courses are generally of good quality, but not outstanding. At Edinburgh Uni, lecturers are completely normal people who do solid work. Most of them are very much under pressure to produce research output to maintain the high position in rankings which sometimes affects quality of teaching. 
Student accommodation at Edinburgh Uni is basically a scam. Rooms are much more expensive than on the private market and are mostly taken by rich (Chinese) students from overseas. I think this is the weakest point of the university. There is a lot of networking potential lost in making student accommodation accessible only to the rich.
The other weak point of the university are the high tuition fees, especially for overseas students. Basically, you only get either very rich people or people with scholarships.
Overall, it's the best university in Scotland and one of the best in the UK. Very well respected, but you won't appear overqualified (as might be a problem e.g. with an Oxbridge degree)."}

{'Tell us about your overall university experience so far.': "First off, Edinburgh is a fantastic place to live and study in. This University will open many doors for you in the future, particularly if you're studying science/medicine etc (I'm studying BSc Biological Sciences (Hons)). If you're also aspiring to do biology here, the course in the first semester isn't especially great but only because its very general as they're trying to show you all aspects of biology in order for you to accurately pick your honours with regards to your interests. The lecturer's/practical leaders are in general very good however it is a totally different way of learning from school so be prepared. There were a couple of particularly bad lecturer's but they change a lot so you're not going to have a bad one for long. The lecturer's who covered the difficult parts of the course were all fantastic. The accommodation however is DISGUSTING and is the only thing I'm not enjoying so far about being here. I stay in self-catered South Clerk Street and it really is horrible (mice, flies, constantly have no hot water, smell of dampness, bad kitchen appliances, bad furnishings in rooms, the list goes on...). However this is the most cheap accommodation and I have been in the nicer self-catered flats which seem very nice to live in and people who live there enjoy it so my advice is to steer clear of the University cheap self-catered flats. One huge good point though is that you meet so many really lovely people staying in halls, so I would recommend it, just not South Clerk Street! Pollock I have never been to however I've heard the food isn't all that great so it's a waste of money to go catered. Overall, I would recommend Edinburgh as it is the highest ranked Uni in Scotland(just now) and you will go places with a degree from here. "}
